page.title: 06 HISTORY OF BICTON (2)
page.content: In 166O,a Rolle escorted Chas 11 home. The present mansion was built under George 111.Lands were bought & consoli- dated,the 1st Baron Rolle had the gardens landscaped by Le Notre.In 1820, Lord Rolle's 2nd wife,Louisa Trefusis, was a daughter of Baron Clinton & led to a merging of the two families.In the 19th century the lake was built by French prisoners.The estate passed to Mark Trefusis who became a local bene- factor and was involved in the Budleigh railway.19O7-1957,the house was restored by the 21st Baron Clinton,a keen botanist.In WW2,Bicton was used by a school & then the house and farm were rented to the Devon Farm Institute.Devon C.C bought the house in 1955 & today there are 475 agri- cultural students there. (see Farming & Buildings) By A.Kain,J.Ross & 4th Yr.Geographers.
